content: so that the sleeve s cast on edge lies alongside the lh needle this time the lh needle will be at the front and the sleeve s cast on edge will be at the back insert the tip of the rh needle purlwise through the wrong side of the 1st stitch of the cast on edge then continue on through the 1st stitch on the lh needle purl through both layers ie through the cast on edge and the stitch on the lh needle as if you are performing a purl 2 together stitch *purl through the sleeve s next cast on st and the next st on the lh needle you will now have 2 sts on the rh needle bind off 1 st purlwise repeat from * until another 3 sts have been bound off 4 sts bound off in all purl across the rest of the row 46 sts row 52 bind off 4 sts at the beg of the row and knit to the end of the row 42 sts row 53 bind off 4 sts at the beg of the row and purl to the end of the row 38 sts row 54 as for row 52 34 sts row 55 as for row 53 30 sts snip off the yarn leaving about 70cm of yarn to finish off with finishing turn the sleeves the right way out you have 30 sts on each needle join the two lots of 30 sts together with kitchener stitch if kitchener stitch isnt your thing bind off with a 3 needle bindoff instead but kitchener stitch givessuch a professional finish is a useful technique to have in your knitting repertoire and is actually quite fun to do neaten off the loose ends note that there are 2 more row on the back 16 row than the front 14 row which has the effect of making the neckband sit slightly lower on the front mrs rose designs… 4 this pattern is for your personal use
